title: One pick each for Awami League, BNP in new Election Commission
text:
One pick each for Awami League, BNP in new Election Commission Senior Correspondent bdnews24.com   03:38:10.0   03:38:10.0 BdST The 10 names recommended by the Election Commission search committee include an equal number of individuals proposed by the Awami League and the BNP, according to the Cabinet secretary. 
Mohammad Shafiul Alam, whose division provided the panel with secretarial support, made the recommendations public and also announced the new EC headed by former secretary KM Nurul Huda on Monday night. 
President Md Abdul Hamid picked the new election commissioners from the search committee recommendations, which made the list after getting 128 names proposed by the political parties. 
During the announcement at a press conference, Shafiul said two each from the Awami League and the BNP were included in the search committee shortlist of 10. 
The ruling Awami League had proposed the names of former judge Kabita Khanam and former Planning Commission member Abdul Mannan. 
The BNP had two of its choices in the list of 10. Both of them are writers - former additional secretary Mahbub Talukder and Professor Tofail Ahmed. 
One each proposed by the two major parties made it to the EC - Kabita and Mahbub. 
The two other new election commissioners are former secretary Rafiqul Islam and former brigadier general Shahadat Hossain Chowdhury. 
Former cabinet secretary Ali Imam Majumder was the other choice of the search committee for the CEC's post. 
Five years ago, his name had come up as a prospective CEC along with that of Kazi Rakibuddin Ahmad. Majumder, who retired in 2008, has thus been unable to make it to the office for a second time. 
Cabinet Secretary Shafiul, however, 'could not remember' which party proposed Nurul Huda and Ali Imam's names for the CEC job. 
"I can't remember now... but not the two major parties (the Awami League and BNP), some other party," he said on being asked. 
A central leader of Jatiya Samajtantrik Dal (JaSoD), led by Information Minister Hasanul Haq Inu, has told bdnews24.com that they proposed Huda's name. 
Freedom fighter Huda went to the battlefield during the Liberation War under JaSoD founding president major Abdul Jalil. The new CEC also got involved with the JaSoD later. 
Joining Bangladesh Civil Service in 1973, he had remained an officer on special duty (OSD) for a long time during the BNP-Jamaat-e-Islami government before retiring as a secretary in 2006. 
The search committee recommendations also included professors Zarina Rahman Khan and Nazmul Ahsan Kalimullah. 
Shafiul said the new EC includes names proposed by 'all the major parties'. 
Asked which political parties' recommendations other than those of the BNP and Awami League could make it to the list of 10, he said, "I'll have to check the record. I canâ€™t recall." 
He thinks even though the names were proposed by the political parties, the persons are 'impartial'.
